title: Noctes ambrosianæ,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Lawless had studied the law, but, at the instance of Lord Clare, (the Irish Chancellor,) the benchers of the King's Inn, Dublin, refused to call him to the bar, because he had been the warm friend of Robert Emmett.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The Dean has himself informed us, thathis father obtained some agencies and employmentshi Ireland ; but his principal promotion seems tohave been the office of steward to the Society of theKing's Inn, Dublin, to which he was nominated in1665.
